channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: Trading Neutral
item.description: The selling price of a security is the point at which buyers and sellers meet. If the price stays constant at this point it is said to be a neutral market. With options, we can set up trades that profit from non-movement. Join Tom and Tony today as they explain in detail!
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The selling price of a security is the point at which buyers and sellers meet. If the price stays constant at this point it is said to be a neutral market. With options, we can set up trades that profit from non-movement. Join Tom and Tony today a...

item.title: Tradable Crypto Products
item.description:
With the crypto market closing at $2.6 trillion and volatility stabilizing, the number of tradable products in the space has rapidly increased as well.

On tastyworks, there are 21 spot cryptos to trade (from the long side), two bitcoin CME futures (standard and micro size), one Small Exchange future, and two bitcoin ETFs with options that have relatively decent liquidity.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

On tastyworks, there are 21 spot cryptos to trade (from the long side), two bitcoin CME futures (standard and micro size), one Small Exchange future, and two bitcoin ETFs with options that have relatively decent liquidity.

item.title: The Hidden Risk of Iron Condors
item.description: When smaller accounts become big enough to take on more risk, should we increase the number of iron condors we sell? Or widen the long wings out and/or go undefined? Tom and Tony discuss the hidden risk of Iron Condor.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: When smaller accounts become big enough to take on more risk, should we increase the number of iron condors we sell? Or widen the long wings out and/or go undefined? Tom and Tony discuss the hidden risk of Iron Condor.
item.content:encoded: When smaller accounts become big enough to take on more risk, should we increase the number of iron condors we sell? Or widen the long wings out and/or go undefined? Tom and Tony discuss the hidden risk of Iron Condor.

item.title: Five Pertinent Grapics for Q4 2021 and Beyond
item.description:
Nearly 86% of S&P 500 stocks have reported earnings and there are only seven weeks left in 2021. There have been several themes in the market this year but these five graphics are pertinent now and could define the rest of the year and the beginning of 2022.

Join Tony, TP, and Jermal as they examine these five pertinent graphics for Q4 2021 and beyond.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Nearly 86% of S&P 500 stocks have reported earnings and there are only seven weeks left in 2021. There have been several themes in the market this year but these five graphics are pertinent now and could define the rest of the year and the beginni...

Nearly 86% of S&P 500 stocks have reported earnings and there are only seven weeks left in 2021. There have been several themes in the market this year but these five graphics are pertinent now and could define the rest of the year and the beginning of 2022.

Join Tony, TP, and Jermal as they examine these five pertinent graphics for Q4 2021 and beyond.

item.title: Earnings Result Persistence
item.description: Earnings reports and other binary events provide option sellers with time-efficient trading opportunities and specific dates when we can expect volatility contractions, paired with larger than typical price movements. Today, Tom and Jermal examine the data to see how these volatility and price shifts hold up a month after the binary events.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Earnings reports and other binary events provide option sellers with time-efficient trading opportunities and specific dates when we can expect volatility contractions, paired with larger than typical price movements. Today, Tom and Jermal examine...
item.content:encoded: Earnings reports and other binary events provide option sellers with time-efficient trading opportunities and specific dates when we can expect volatility contractions, paired with larger than typical price movements. Today, Tom and Jermal examine the data to see how these volatility and price shifts hold up a month after the binary events.

item.title: Elevated After Earnings
item.description: Surprisingly, there are several equity names that have posted quarterly earnings and yet their IVRs are still elevated. Even more shocking, is that this is occurring in several industries all while equity volatility, vis-à-vis the VIX, is sub-16. Tony, Liz and Jermal take a look at the many equity names that have posted quarterly earnings that curiously still have high IVRs.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Surprisingly, there are several equity names that have posted quarterly earnings and yet their IVRs are still elevated. Even more shocking, is that this is occurring in several industries all while equity volatility, vis-à-vis the VIX, is sub-16. ...

Tony, Liz and Jermal take a look at the many equity names that have posted quarterly earnings that curiously still have high IVRs.

item.title: Volatility and Time
item.description: Volatility is a powerful force in option pricing. Many of the trade decisions we make from entry to exit use volatility as a guide. Join Tony and Scott as they look into the relationship between volatility and time, and also the duration we choose.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Volatility is a powerful force in option pricing. Many of the trade decisions we make from entry to exit use volatility as a guide. Join Tony and Scott as they look into the relationship between volatility and time, and also the duration we choose...
item.content:encoded: Volatility is a powerful force in option pricing. Many of the trade decisions we make from entry to exit use volatility as a guide. Join Tony and Scott as they look into the relationship between volatility and time, and also the duration we choose.

item.title: Yet Another GME-esque Move
item.description: CAR’s move, although similar to GME in terms of magnitude and surprise factor, is not identical from an IV perspective (at least not yet), and selling premium into a move like this should be done with extremely small quantities.Like always, there is no edge in guessing direction even after a large up move. The better answer is to reduce trade size and treat this stock like any other high IV underlying.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: CAR’s move, although similar to GME in terms of magnitude and surprise factor, is not identical from an IV perspective (at least not yet), and selling premium into a move like this should be done with extremely small quantities.Like always, there ...

The better answer is to reduce trade size and treat this stock like any other high IV underlying.

item.title: IV Overstatement
item.description:
We often rely on expected moves which are derived from IV when selecting strikes to trade. But it's commonly observed that these expected moves generally overstate the actual amount of price action in an underlying. 

Tom and Tony examine the data to see how true this is and why it doesn’t contradict the efficient market hypothesis.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: We often rely on expected moves which are derived from IV when selecting strikes to trade. But it's commonly observed that these expected moves generally overstate the actual amount of price action in an underlying. Tom and Tony examine the data t...
item.content:encoded:
We often rely on expected moves which are derived from IV when selecting strikes to trade. But it's commonly observed that these expected moves generally overstate the actual amount of price action in an underlying. 

Tom and Tony examine the data to see how true this is and why it doesn’t contradict the efficient market hypothesis.

item.title: Leaving a Lasting Legacy
item.description:
Legacy payment institutions are often managing a “patchwork” of aging systems that simply cannot keep up with all the changes occurring in the market. Additionally, the move to real-time payments is also putting pressure on these institutions to modernize. The emergence of cryptocurrencies is behind it all.

Join Tom, Tony, and Jermal as they discuss recent trading and IVR of a few names in the payments industry.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Legacy payment institutions are often managing a “patchwork” of aging systems that simply cannot keep up with all the changes occurring in the market. Additionally, the move to real-time payments is also putting pressure on these institutions to m...

Legacy payment institutions are often managing a “patchwork” of aging systems that simply cannot keep up with all the changes occurring in the market. Additionally, the move to real-time payments is also putting pressure on these institutions to modernize. The emergence of cryptocurrencies is behind it all.

Join Tom, Tony, and Jermal as they discuss recent trading and IVR of a few names in the payments industry.

item.title: Key Distributions in Finance
item.description:
While price returns are roughly symmetrical and normally distributed, volatility clusters frequently to one side and only moves big to the upside.

Depending on the financial instrument you trade, the underlying mechanics of the asset will be based on one of these two distributions in some way.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: While price returns are roughly symmetrical and normally distributed, volatility clusters frequently to one side and only moves big to the upside. Depending on the financial instrument you trade, the underlying mechanics of the asset will be based...

Depending on the financial instrument you trade, the underlying mechanics of the asset will be based on one of these two distributions in some way.

item.title: Not Just Any Day
item.description: Earnings season is a busy time for tastytraders. Each earnings announcement gives its underlying a predictable day with an atypically large amount of price action. Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much more price action occurs at earnings than on a typical day and contrast pre-earnings IV to average IV.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Earnings season is a busy time for tastytraders. Each earnings announcement gives its underlying a predictable day with an atypically large amount of price action. Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much more price action occurs at earnings ...

Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much more price action occurs at earnings than on a typical day and contrast pre-earnings IV to average IV.

item.title: The Optimum Time to Sell Earnings Volatility
item.description:
Quarterly earnings provide the perfect opportunity for tastytraders to get short volatility. The binary event of stock moment and IV crush is ripe for profitability provided the stock does not move too much. However, can one sell earnings volatility too early? Is there an optimum time to sell?

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they discuss the optimum time to sell earnings volatility.

item.itunes:subtitle: Quarterly earnings provide the perfect opportunity for tastytraders to get short volatility. The binary event of stock moment and IV crush is ripe for profitability provided the stock does not move too much. However, can one sell earnings volatili...

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they discuss the optimum time to sell earnings volatility.

item.title: Crypto at All Time High
item.description:
The leading cryptos (BTC and ETH) are trading near all time highs while their IVs, expected moves, and price volatilities remain constant.

Volatility of the crypto space is around the same as natural gas and around 5 to 6x that of the equity markets.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

The leading cryptos (BTC and ETH) are trading near all time highs while their IVs, expected moves, and price volatilities remain constant.

Volatility of the crypto space is around the same as natural gas and around 5 to 6x that of the equity markets.

item.title: Advanced Expected Moves
item.description: Looking at the expected move can be a crucial first step when it comes to picking which strikes to trade. Today, Tom and Tony explore a more sophisticated method for reaching the expected range of an underlying, using only tools readily available in the platform.
